definitions.definition: To cause to become completely permeated with, or soaked (especially with a liquid).
examples: After walking home in the driving rain, his clothes were saturated .

definitions.definition: To fill thoroughly or to excess.
examples: Modern television is saturated with violence.

definitions.definition: To satisfy the affinity of; to cause a substance to become inert by chemical combination with all that it can hold.
examples: One can saturate phosphorus with chlorine.

definitions.definition: To render pure, or of a colour free from white light.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To cause to become completely permeated with, or soaked (especially with a liquid).
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , figurative ) To fill thoroughly or to excess.
( transitive , chemistry ) To satisfy the affinity of; to cause a substance to become inert by chemical combination with all that it can hold.
( transitive , optics ) To render pure, or of a colour free from white light.
